intro: Psychotria menalohensis, commonly known as the Menalohense Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
